title: I’m a nutritionist from Japan, home to the world's longest-living people—here are 5 longevity foods we eat every day
description: Asako Miyashita has been a nutritionist and longevity expert for nearly 20 years. Born and raised in Japan, where some of the world's longest-living people reside, she shares the Japanese staple foods she eats every day to stay healthy and live longer.

title: Senators press crypto exchange Binance on potentially illegal business practices after FTX collapse
description: Senators are pressing Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, for detailed information on its finances and compliance practices.

title: Activist hedge fund manager Dan Loeb takes a passive stake in AMD
description: Third Point's Dan Loeb has taken a passive stake in chipmaker AMD, sources told CNBC's Scott Wapner.

title: ESPN wants to be the hub of all live sports streaming — even if it helps its competition
description: The idea aims to make ESPN the TV guide of live sports. The network has held talks with major leagues and media companies, sources said.

title: Tesla's plan to slash silicon carbide use sends some chipmakers' shares down
description: Tesla plans to slash use of silicon carbide transistors 75%, powertrain engineering leader Colin Campbell told investors Wednesday.

title: Salesforce is having its best day since 2020 after blowout earnings report
description: Salesforce beat estimates on Wednesday, and activist investor Elliott Management was complimentary after the company showed margin improvement.

title: At least 20 torture centers in Kherson were directly financed by the Kremlin, international lawyers say in a new report
description: Electric shock torture and waterboarding are among the criminal acts described by Ukrainian women and men imprisoned at the torture sites in Kherson.

title: Ford plans to restart production of the electric F-150 Lightning on March 13
description: Ford plans to restart production of its electric F-150 Lightning pickup on March 13 – more than a month after a battery issue caused a vehicle to catch fire.

title: Ford's February sales jump 22% from subdued results in 2022
description: Sales of Ford's F-Series pickups increased 22% last month compared to a year earlier, including a spike in sales of its electric F-150 Lightning.

title: SpaceX launches Crew-6 mission for NASA, sending four more astronauts to the space station
description: SpaceX launched four people from Florida as Elon Musk's company begins the final of the original six missions awarded by NASA.

title: A South Korean telco giant has its own A.I. chatbot — and says it's a 'super app' version of ChatGPT
description: SK Telecom is planning this year to fully launch "A.", its artificial intelligence chatbot and its answer to OpenAI's ChatGPT.

title: Euro zone inflation softens to 8.5% in February as ECB signals interest rate hiking is not over
description: Inflation in the euro zone came in at 8.5% in February.

title: Not all passports are created equal. Here's a list of the most powerful ones
description: The United Arab Emirates has the strongest passport in the world, followed by Luxembourg and Switzerland, according to a 2023 index by Nomad Capitalist.

title: Bangladesh urges G-20 to force companies making profit from Ukraine war to compensate poor nations
description: A UN report said the fallout from Ukraine's war could dramatically worsen the economic outlook for developing countries already grappling with debt financing.

title: This is one metal investors can consider buying on dip 'at any chance' they get, according to an analyst
description: There is one metal that investors should buy on dip should an opportunity present itself, according to Jonathan Barratt, CEO of Celsius Pro.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets reeled as Fed officials confirmed commitment to high interest rates
description: Hawkish sentiment from Fed officials and higher manufacturing prices weighed on stocks and buoyed Treasury yields, giving markets a bad start to March.

title: Singapore's online portal PropertyGuru remains in the red even as fourth quarter revenue jumped
description: PropertyGuru stays in the red for the fourth quarter of 2022, after slipping from a net profit position in the second quarter.

title: Major fears are sweeping into Israel's economy
description: A proposed Israeli law would effectively end the role of country's Supreme Court as a check on executive and legislative power. Investors are taking notice.

title: Layoffs are set to continue. But workers from this sector may likely escape
description: Only 10% of organizations are likely to cut jobs in cybersecurity, compared to an average of 20% in other areas, according to a survey by ISC2.

title: Here's how much economists expect China's GDP to grow this year
description: The Chinese government is widely expected to announce on Sunday a GDP growth target of around or above 5% for the year.
